Here's one other slightly different thought on the issue of hand-coded
TestSuites:

During a particular coding session I may want to create a customized subset
of my regression test suite, one that contains only those tests that I think
may be likely to be relevant to the code I'm changing. Or maybe I even know
that a particular group of tests is failing because of a change that I'm in
the middle of making.

Maybe it's more convenient (i.e., quick) for me to run just this subset of
tests, when I'm running the tests over and over again during debugging.

Of course I don't assume that my guess is correct: before I declare myself
done I run the whole regression suite and make sure it passes. My ad hoc
Test Suite is just a temporary tool; I throw it away when I check in.

- arb
subject: RE: Test Suites Useless?
